label: Who can benefit from Génération 2024 coupons?
body:
Coupons are only available to schools with the Génération 2024 programme.



The project can involve one or more classes. If this is not the case, the school wishing to benefit from the coupons must be part of the Génération 2024 certification process and obtain it before being eligible.

label: Quels articles sont interdits sur les sites de compétition des Jeux ?
body:
Un guide du spectateur est prévu pour chaque discipline sportive et site de compétition associé. Il recensera, entre autres, la liste des objets interdits.

Ce guide sera envoyé par e-mail aux spectateurs et sera disponible au format PDF sur l'application mobile Paris 2024.



En attendant d'avoir la liste définitive des objets interdits, il est important de noter que :

 * Seuls les petits parapluies pliants seront autorisés, tandis que les grands parapluies non pliables seront strictement interdits.

 * Les gourdes en plastique d'une contenance de moins de 75 cl seront autorisées, cependant, les gourdes en verre seront strictement interdites.

Pour obtenir davantage d'informations sur l'ensemble des objets interdits, veuillez rester attentif à l'arrivée des guides spectateurs.



Télécharger l’application mobile :

https://olympics.com/en/download-olympics-mobile-app? label: What are the Olympic and Paralympic promotional events?
body:
The school year is marked by at least four significant events:



 * The Olympic and Paralympic Week, which will take place from 2 to 6 April, 2024

 * Olympic Day on 23 June

 * National School Sports Day (JNSS) and University Sports Day in September

 * Paralympic Day in October



Beyond these three national highlights, the organisation of academic events related to sports is regularly encouraged.

Similarly, hosting major international sports events (GESI) on the territory is a real opportunity for students to attend as spectators or participate as volunteers in these competitions.



Alongside these major events, the Cultural Olympiad extends the experience offered to young people by exploring the connection between art and sport. Since April 2023, schools and institutions can submit artistic and cultural education projects that will be awarded the Cultural Olympiad label.

label: Quelle est la procédure de candidature pour obtenir le label Terre de Jeux 2024 ?
body:
La procédure de candidature s'effectue en ligne directement sur le site internet Terre de Jeux.

Pour plus d’information, rendez-vous sur :

terredejeux.paris2024.org [http://terredejeux.paris2024.org/]



Elle a été pensée pour être simple et rapide. La possibilité d'obtention du label ne rend pas obligatoire un vote du conseil municipal.

Les collectivités sont invitées à déposer des candidatures individuelles afin d’autoriser l’usage de la marque localement. Toutefois, l’animation du label peut être confié à un acteur qui regroupe plusieurs acteurs (intercommunalité, département, etc.).

Une fois la candidature déposée, vous recevrez un mail de confirmation (n'hésitez pas à regarder dans les courriers indésirables).



Un mois après votre candidature, si vous n'avez rien reçu, nous vous invitons à joindre notre équipe sur :

terredejeux2024@paris2024.org.



Les labellisations se font sur un rythme régulier au fil des candidatures, avec un délai d'instruction de quelques semaines entre le dépôt de la candidature et la réponse sur l'obtention ou non du label.
topics: Autres;Terre de Jeux;Label - Terre de Jeux

label: What is the standard hiring process?
body:
When receiving your application, a recruiter will examine your resume and might ask you for an additional video or telephone interview.

In the following step, if your application is successful, you will be invited to an individual or group interview with a manager and/or a recruiter.

A final interview might be required depending on the position.



When validating your applicaiton, the recruiter will make a formal offer to you.

label: Are the olympic and paralympic competition venues the same?
body:
All the paralympic venues, except for the road events, are identical to the olympic venues.

The paralympic sports, with the exception of Shooting para sport in Châteauroux, are all located in the Paris Region.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/competition-venue-concept/

label: Qu'est-ce que les voies olympiques et resteront-elles ouvertes à la circulation générale ?
body:
Les voies olympiques sont les voies empruntées par les véhicules de services transport Paris 2024, les véhicules de secours et de sécurité, et d'autres ayants droits identifiés dans le décret.

Elles peuvent être réservées et seront signalées par du marquage au sol et des panneaux.

Sur le périphérique de Paris et les autoroutes, il s'agit d'une voie ou portion de voie réservée dans chaque sens.



Les voies olympiques sont établies par décret. Les dates d'activation de ces voies et les modalités de contrôle seront annoncées par la Préfecture de Police :

https://www.prefecturedepolice.interieur.gouv.fr [https://www.prefecturedepolice.interieur.gouv.fr/perimetresJOP]



Plus d'informations sur les conditions de circulation sont disponibles ici :

https://anticiperlesjeux.gouv.fr/

label: What items are prohibited at the competition venues?
body:
A spectator guide is planned for each sport discipline and associated competition venue. It will include, among other things, the list of prohibited items.

This guide will be sent via email to spectators and will be available in PDF format on the Paris 2024 mobile application.

While awaiting the final list of prohibited items, it is important to note that:

 * Only small folding umbrellas will be allowed, while large non-collapsible umbrellas will be strictly prohibited.

 * Plastic water bottles with a capacity of less than 75 cl will be permitted, however, glass bottles will be strictly prohibited.

For more information on the full list of prohibited items, please stay tuned for the arrival of the spectator guides.



Download the mobile app:

https://olympics.com/en/download-olympics-mobile-app?

label: Comment puis-je arriver en taxi/VTC sur un site ?
body:
Paris 2024 recommande aux spectateurs de se rendre sur les sites de compétition en transport en commun ou en mobilités actives.

Concernant l’accès aux sites de compétitions en taxi ou en VTC, ces informations seront précisées dans le Guide du spectateur qui vous sera communiqué avant le début des compétitions.



Pour les PSH, l'accès en taxi ou en VTC est possible.

label: How can I receive the Génération 2024 Newsletter?
body:
The Génération 2024 Newsletter will keep you up to date with all the latest news from the Generation 2024 programme, showcasing the best educational projects, new content about the Paris 2024 Games, and many other surprises.



To receive the quarterly newsletter for free, simply sign up here:

https://generation.paris2024.org/newsletter



By subscribing to the newsletter, you become a member of Generation 2024.

label: Puis-je venir au site à vélo et le stationner ?
body:
Dans la région d'Île-de-France, des itinéraires spécialement dédiés seront mis à disposition pour faciliter vos déplacements à vélo en direction des sites de compétition où des stationnements seront mis en place.

Pour les collectivités hôtes en région, toutes les informations pertinentes sur le stationnement sont disponibles sur le site des villes concernées.

Chaque site d'Île-de-France est équipé de parkings vélo spectateurs barriérés.



Ces parkings seront également gardiennés d'1h30 avant chaque épreuve de compétition à 1h30 après.



Les spectateurs à vélo seront invités à verrouiller casques et batteries électriques sur leur vélo, qui sera laissé en toute sécurité.



Voici une liste non exhaustive des liens vers les sites des collectivités hôtes

Île-de-France :

https://www.iledefrance.fr/

In Lille :

https://lillemetropole.fr/

Bordeaux :

https://www.bordeaux.fr/

Lyon :

https://www.lyon.fr/decouvrir-lyon/portrait-dune-ville/la-metropole-de-lyon

Marseille :

https://www.marseille.fr/

Nice :

https://www.nicecotedazur.org/

Châteauroux :

https://www.chateauroux-metropole.fr/accueil

Saint-Étienne :

https://www.saint-etienne.fr/



Des informations détaillées concernant chaque site de compétition seront fournies dans le guide du spectateur, qui vous sera communiqué avant le début de votre session.

label: What is the priority access policy for Paris 2024 venues?
body:
If you have a disability or reduced mobility, you will be entitled to priority access at the site's entry points, as well as at various concessions and counters.



Individuals considered to have reduced mobility (PRM):

 * All individuals with a disability card

 * Elderly individuals

 * Pregnant women

 * Visible and invisible disabilities

 * Temporary disabilities (broken ankle)

 * Individuals with a specific condition having difficulty standing and/or moving



An accompanying person and minors will also have access to the priority queue.

label: Paris 2024 propose-t-il une solution d’hébergement pour les volontaires ou des spectateurs issus de collectivités Terre de Jeux 2024 ?
body:
Paris 2024 n’a pas vocation à proposer de solution d’hébergement pour les volontaires ou les détenteurs de billets.

Cependant, notre partenaire ANDES (Association Nationale des Elus en charge du Sport) propose un dispositif dans ce sens :

https://andes.fr/actualites/une-solution-dhebergement-collectif-jop-paris-2024/

label: How can I delete my account and my personal data?​
body:
Paris 2024 undertakes to respect your rights regarding your personal data.

Your account and your personal data can be deleted at your request by filling the following form (hyperlink).

Please note that your deletion request will apply to all data collected by IOC and Paris 2024 websites/applications where you have registered, including: Olympics.com [http://olympics.com/], Club Paris 2024, Marathon pour Tous, Generation 2024, Terre de Jeux 2024, Olympiade Culturelle, Ticketing platform, Volunteer platform, Torch Relay platform, etc.

If you have submitted your application on the volunteer website, it will be deleted.

If you have an entry for Marathon Pour Tous, it will be deleted.

label: Qu'est-ce que l'album Panini Équipe de France ?
body:
Le 2 avril 2024, pour célébrer son 50ᵉ anniversaire, Panini France a lancé une collection de stickers consacrée à l'Équipe de France Olympique et Paralympique.

Composé de 469, dont 81 spéciaux, cet album de 80 pages offre une véritable galerie de portraits représentant 441 athlètes qui porteront haut les couleurs de la France cet été. Des stars établies aux espoirs émergents, des sportifs issus de tous les sports sont mis à l’honneur dans l’album, illustrant la diversité et la richesse du sport et du talent français.

Règles, anecdotes, histoire, nombre de médailles obtenues depuis les premiers Jeux Olympiques de l’ère moderne, chaque sport et chaque discipline sont représentés et expliqués.

Cet album est le guide indispensable pour suivre l’événement au jour le jour et saisir la détermination des athlètes tricolores à travers des vignettes magnifiquement illustrées.

Grâce à ces stickers, les fans auront l’opportunité de soutenir leurs champion(ne)s tout au long de leur périple olympique et paralympique, créant ainsi un lien indéfectible entre supporters et athlètes !



Pour plus d’information, rendez-vous sur :

https://www.equipedefrance.com/article/panini-efr
topics: Sports;Sports olympiques et paralympiques;Équipe de France

label: Where will the Paralympic Flame pass through?
body:
The 12 Flames will set off from the suburbs of the French mainland on the first day of the Relay, progressing simultaneously into the heart of the regions on the second day, arriving in the Île-de-France region on the third day and finally reuniting in Paris for the fourth and final day of the Relay.



Find out more about the Paralympic Relay course here:

https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/olympic-torch-relay/map
topics: Torch Relay Route ;The Torch Relay route

label: Est-il possible d'utiliser les propriétés protégées olympiques, paralympiques et de Paris 2024 ?
body:
L'utilisation des propriétés olympiques, paralympiques et de Paris 2024 est strictement encadrée. 

Les partenaires (commerciaux et institutionnels) des Jeux Olympiques et Paralympiques de Paris 2024 en ont l’exclusivité.

En d’autres termes, les propriétés ne peuvent être utilisées à des fins commerciales, de représentation ou encore de communication par des personnes n’ayant pas contracté avec Paris 2024, le Comité International Olympique ou le Comité International Paralympique.



Nous vous invitons à retrouver toutes les informations concernant notre politique de protection de marque dans ce guide :

https://medias.paris2024.org/uploads/2023/07/BIL_20230703_Brand_Protection.pdf



Cependant, nous accordons une certaine tolérance aux projets pédagogiques, dans le respect des usages liés à notre programme Génération 2024, et selon les modalités suivantes :



 * Le projet doit posséder un caractère pédagogique et participer à la valorisation de Paris 2024

 * L’usage des propriétés protégées n’est valable que dans un contexte pédagogique

 * Le projet ne doit pas porter préjudice aux partenaires du CIO, de l’IPC et de Paris 2024

 * Aucune marque ne peut être directement associée aux propriétés protégées (anneaux, agitos, etc.)

 * Le projet ne peut être relayé que dans le cadre d’une communication interne, sans visibilité externe

label: I am a merchant near a competition site, how are my deliveries ensured?
body:
As a merchant located near a site within a restricted traffic zone, it is essential to reach out to your local community for precise information on how your deliveries and operations will be facilitated during restricted periods.



For more information on security perimeters, please visit:

https://anticiperlesjeux.gouv.fr/



If you work in Paris and the Île-de-France region, please consult the following sites:

https://www.paris.fr/pages/perimetres-de-securite-et-circulation-pendant-les-jeux-comment-ca-marche-25203

https://www.prefecturedepolice.interieur.gouv.fr/perimetresJOP

label: Est-il possible de personnaliser des produits avec les propriétés protégées olympiques, paralympiques et de Paris 2024 ?
body:
L’usage des propriétés protégées est strictement encadrée et ne peut pas être personnalisée.

Nous vous invitons à prendre connaissance de cet encadrement présenté dans la réponse à la question "MARQUE - Est-il possible d'utiliser les propriétés protégées olympiques, paralympiques et de Paris 2024 ?".

Les établissements scolaires sont autorisés à personnaliser les produits de la boutique Génération 2024 ou SOP.

Les règles applicables sont les suivantes :

 * Il n’est pas possible d’associer directement votre logo (établissement) aux propriétés protégées de Paris 2024 (emblèmes, logo, anneaux olympiques, agitos …). Votre logo doit être positionné dans un emplacement opposé à celui du logo Génération 2024 ou SOP

 * La personnalisation s’effectue exclusivement sur des produits de notre boutique via des prestataires de Paris 2024. Nous pouvons vous partager le contact du prestataire pour le flocage de votre logo

 * La création de produits personnalisés ou non par un prestataire tiers n’est pas autorisé

 * Les produits personnalisés ne peuvent être commercialisés
   
   

Pour information, vous trouverez ci-dessous les conditions d’accès aux différentes boutiques :



Boutique Génération 2024, votre établissement est labellisé Génération 2024 :https://generation.paris2024.org/label-generation-2024

Boutique SOP, vous participez ou avez participé à la Semaine Olympique et Paralympique :

https://generation.paris2024.org/edition-2024

label: I live near a site, how can I access my home?
body:
People residing within a security perimeter to be set up during the Olympic and Paralympic Games should contact their local authorities for information on how to move within these perimeters.



For more information on security perimeters, please visit:

https://anticiperlesjeux.gouv.fr/



If you live in Paris and the Île-de-France region, please consult the following websites:

https://www.paris.fr/pages/perimetres-de-securite-et-circulation-pendant-les-jeux-comment-ca-marche-25203

https://www.prefecturedepolice.interieur.gouv.fr/perimetresJOP

label: Une application mobile dédiée est-elle prévue pour les Jeux Olympiques et Paralympiques de Paris 2024 ?
body:
Une application mobile conçue pour les Jeux de Paris 2024 est désormais disponible en téléchargement !

Elle offrira à tous la possibilité de suivre les programmes et les résultats des différentes compétitions ainsi que des contenus inédits sur les Jeux et les athlètes.

De nombreuses fonctionnalités seront également mises à disposition des spectateurs :

 * Une carte interactive du site de compétition

 * Des informations sur ma session

 * Un lien vers le guide spectateur etc



Cette application mobile se distingue de l'application mobile pour accéder à son billet qui sortira à la mi-mai.



Télécharger l’application mobile :

https://olympics.com/en/download-olympics-mobile-app? [https://olympics.com/en/download-olympics-mobile-app?_branch_match_id=1298005965559121406&utm_source=olympics.com&utm_campaign=download-app-lp-qr-code&utm_medium=site&_branch_referrer=H4sIAAAAAAAAA8soKSkottLXz8%2BpzC3ITC7WSywo0MvJzMvWTzQ1T%2FF3Da1IzEoCACOderolAAAA%EF%BF%BC]



Pour en savoir plus, rendez-vous sur :

https://www.paris2024.org/fr/spectateurs/

label: How can I arrive at a venue by taxi or cab driving service?
body:
Paris 2024 recommends spectators to travel to competition venues using public transport or active mobility options.

Regarding access to competition venues by taxi or Ride-Hailing Service, this information will be detailed in the Spectator Guide provided to you before the start of the competitions.



For Persons with disability (PSH), access by taxi or cab driving service is possible.
topics: Spectators;Public transport;Getting to the competition venues

label: Est-il possible d’utiliser l’emblème de Paris 2024 ?
body:
L’utilisation des propriétés olympiques, paralympiques et de Paris 2024 est strictement encadrée. 

Les partenaires (commerciaux et institutionnels) des Jeux Olympiques et Paralympiques de Paris 2024 en ont l’exclusivité.

En d’autres termes, les propriétés visuelles et verbales ne peuvent être utilisées à des fins commerciales, de représentation ou encore de communication par des personnes n’ayant pas contracté avec Paris 2024, le CIO ou IPC.



Vous trouverez toutes les informations concernant notre politique de protection de marque dans ce guide :

https://medias.paris2024.org/uploads/2023/07/BIL_20230703_Brand_Protection.pdf



Pour candidater à une licence de la marque Paris 2024, il est nécessaire de répondre à un appel à manifestation d’intérêt.



L’appel à manifestation d’intérêt est publié sur le site

https://www.maximilien.fr/

label: How can my local authority, Terre de Jeux 2024, help people win race numbers for the Marathon Pour Tous?
body:
Communities bearing the Terre de Jeux 2024 programme have the opportunity to offer race bibs for participants in local races.

These races, covering distances of 10, 20, or 42 km, must not be affiliated with a commercial name and must be certified by the FFA.



To apply, please complete the application form available here [https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=KOKcwCgDkEe621FkmgClHC7zfUbY93tDqFmglxvNIVxUMUk3R09RS1lXTklLNVg5Q0I5TzFGTFBVTi4u].



For more information, please visit:

https://terredejeux.paris2024.org/faq

label: Suite à l'obtention du label Terre de Jeux 2024, la collectivité a-t-elle le droit d'utiliser l'emblème Paris 2024 ?
body:
La marque Paris 2024 est protégée et est à l’usage exclusif du Comité d’Organisation, des territoires hôtes et des partenaires commerciaux.

Tous les labellisés pourront utiliser le label Terre de Jeux 2024 et ainsi faire vivre le projet localement.

L’usage de ce label est soumis à un guide d’usage qui définit les conditions d’usage comme l’impossibilité de faire coexister ce label avec une marque commerciale non-partenaire de Paris 2024.

La typographie Paris 2024 est protégée par le CIO et ne peut pas être utilisée par les labellisés Terre de jeux 2024.

Son usage est réservé exclusivement à Paris 2024. En revanche, vous avez la possibilité d’utiliser les polices Source Sans Pro et/ou Arial.



Pour en savoir plus, rendez-vous sur :

https://terredejeux.paris2024.org/faq

label: Does Paris 2024 offer accommodation solutions for volunteers or spectators from Terre de Jeux 2024 communities?
body:
Paris 2024 does not have the mandate to provide accommodation solutions for volunteers or ticket holders.

However, our partner ANDES (National Association of Elected Officials in charge of Sports) offers a scheme in this regard:

https://andes.fr/actualites/une-solution-dhebergement-collectif-jop-paris-2024/

label: Comment acheter des packages hospitalité de Paris 2024 ?
body:
Il existe 3 canaux officiels pour acheter des packages hospitalité de Paris 2024 :



Pour les offres Grand Public :

Olympic Games Paris 2024| Hospitality and Travel Packages [https://hospitalitytravelpackages.paris2024.org/discover?language=fr]



Pour les offres Entreprises et Groupes :

Olympic Games Paris 2024 | Business Enquiry [https://corporatehospitality.paris2024.org/fr]



Via le réseau mondial de Sous-Distributeurs officiels d’On Location :

Sous-distributeurs officiels - On Location Olympic and Paralympic Games Paris 2024 [https://olympics.onlocationexp.com/paris2024/fr/sous-distributeurs-officiels/]

label: Following the award of the Terre de Jeux 2024 programme, does the local authority have the right to use the Paris 2024 emblem?
body:
The Paris 2024 brand is protected and is for the exclusive use of the Organising Committee, host territories, and commercial partners.

All those labelled will be able to use the Terre de Jeux 2024 programme and thus bring the project to life locally.

The use of this programme is subject to a usage guide which defines the conditions of use, such as the impossibility of coexisting this label with a non-partner commercial brand of Paris 2024.

The typography Paris 2024 is protected by the IOC and cannot be used by Terre de Jeux 2024 programme holders.

Its use is reserved exclusively for Paris 2024. However, you have the option to use the fonts Source Sans Pro and/or Arial.



For more information, please visit:

https://terredejeux.paris2024.org/

label: Où puis-je célébrer les athlètes olympiques pendant les Jeux ?
body:
Les athlètes olympiques français seront célébrés à Paris au sein du Club France à La Villette.

Pour tous les médaillés internationaux au Parc des Champions les jours suivant leur podium au Trocadéro et partout en France dans les Clubs 2024 avec retransmission télévisée.



Pour en savoir plus, rendez-vous sur :

https://www.paris2024.org/fr/celebrer-les-jeux/
topics: Spectateurs ;Activités pendant les Jeux;Célébrations et festivités;Questions générales

label: Can I customize the products I purchase from the shop?
body:
Some of the products are now customizable with the option to add your organization's logo. These are indicated on the shop's website.



If the products you wish to order do not exist, you can propose them to us via email: terredejeux2024@paris2024.org
topics: Other;Terre de Jeux;Terre de Jeux 2024 shop

label: Quand est-ce que la Carte des Jeux sera disponible ?
body:
Paris 2024 lancera fin avril 2024 la Carte des Jeux !



Pour en savoir plus, rendez-vous sur :

https://www.paris2024.org/fr/celebrer-les-jeux/
topics: Spectateurs ;Activités pendant les Jeux;Célébrations et festivités;La Carte des Jeux

label: What are the intervention themes of the endowment Fund?
body:
The five main areas of intervention for the endowment Fund are:

 * Sport as a vector of health and well-being

 * Sport for education and citizenship

 * Sport for inclusion, solidarity, and equality

 * Sport for the environment

 * Sport for employment and professional integration

Initiatives combining sport and culture are also eligible for support from the endowment Fund.

The endowment Fund prioritizes projects aimed at audiences distant from sports practice and/or in situations of vulnerability, implemented in an underserved territory.

Every eligible project benefits from the use of the “Impact 2024” signature, following the communicated usage rules.

label: Comment fonctionnera la Carte des Jeux ?
body:
La Carte des Jeux a pour but de répertorier l’ensemble des événements liés à Paris 2024, dans toute la France.

En un clic, il sera possible de découvrir toutes les informations sur les activités proposées près de chez soi en lien avec les Jeux (les sites de compétition, les boutiques, etc.) et avec la célébration des Jeux.
topics: Spectateurs ;Activités pendant les Jeux;Célébrations et festivités;La Carte des Jeux

label: When will the official resale platform open?
body:
The official resale platform for the Paris 2024 Games will open on 15th May 2024.

This will be the exclusive official site for ticket holders worldwide wishing to resell their ticket(s). More information will be provided in due course.



Purchasing tickets or hospitality packages outside the official distribution channels may result in tickets not being received or denial of access to the competition venues by the organising Committees of the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games, in accordance with the current terms and conditions of sale.



Furthermore, any unauthorised sale or resale outside the official distribution channels may constitute both a civil and criminal offence, punishable under Article 313-6-2 of the Penal Code.



For any ticketing-related questions, please visit Paris 2024 help center:

https://tickets.paris2024.org/faq/en_en

label: Qu'est-ce que la campagne "Rendez-vous avec l'histoire" ?
body:
"Rendez-vous avec l'histoire" est la campagne de communication qui accompagnera l'Équipe de France Olympique et Paralympique jusqu'aux Jeux.

Elle s'articule autour d'un film qui montre le passage de témoin entre des légendes du sport français et des athlètes qui représenteront la France à Paris, qui tous ont été ou sont déterminés à marquer l'histoire.

Les athlètes, mais également les légendes, les supporters... la France entière a rendez-vous avec l'histoire à Paris cet été.

La campagne dans ses différentes versions sera à retrouver à la télévision, sur les réseaux sociaux, au Club France ou encore dans les sites de célébrations.
topics: Sports;Sports olympiques et paralympiques;Équipe de France

label: What are the Clubs 2024?
body:
The Clubs 2024 are celebration zones allowing everyone to gather around the Games (broadcasting of the Games, entertainment, cultural discoveries, etc).

Terre de Jeux 2024 communities have been able to submit their club projects for consideration, and there will be over 200 Clubs 2024 all over France!

Communities participating in the Clubs 2024 programme will be able to broadcast the Olympic and Paralympic Games freely and at no cost.

label: Où trouver un vélo pour me rendre aux sites de compétition ?
body:
Pour accéder aux différents sites de compétition, vous aurez la possibilité de louer des vélos via des services spécialisés ou d'utiliser des vélos en libre-service.

En Île-de-France, la flotte de vélos en libre-service sera étendue et des stations éphémères seront installées aux abords des sites de compétitions.

Dans les villes hôtes qui accueillent des compétitions, des services de vélos en libre-service sont également disponibles.

Toutes les informations relatives aux services de vélos en libre-service peuvent être consultées sur les sites internet des collectivités hôtes.



Pour plus d’information, voici une liste non exhaustive des sites internet des collectivités hôtes :

Île-de-France :

Nice :

label: How can I find out which public transport lines will serve each competition venue?
body:
Initial information specifying the stations and public transport lines serving each venue can be found in the "How to get there" section on the pages of each competition venue.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/competition-venue-concept/



For more information on the public transport lines serving the various competition venues in Île-de-France, download the mobile app "Public Transport Paris 2024":

https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/dossiers/app-transport-public-paris2024
topics: Spectators;Public transport;Getting to the competition venues

label: Comment puis-je connaître les lignes de transports en commun qui desserviront chaque site de compétition ?
body:
Des premières informations précisant les gares, les stations et les lignes de transport en commun desservant chaque site sont présentes dans la section « Comment s’y rendre » des pages de chaque site de compétition.



Pour en savoir plus, rendez-vous sur :

https://www.paris2024.org/fr/sites-de-competition/



Pour avoir des informations sur les lignes de transports en commun qui desserviront les différents sites de compétition, en Île-de-France, télécharger l’application mobile « Transport Public Paris 2024 » :

https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/dossiers/app-transport-public-paris2024

label: Will public transport services be stepped up during the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games?
body:
Paris 2024 has made strong commitments to sustainable mobility to limit the environmental impact of the Games.

In this regard, all venues will be served by public transport, and a tailored transport plan will be implemented during the Games.

To travel by public transport, you will use the Île-de-France Mobilités network, which encompasses all train, RER, metro, tramway, and bus lines in Paris and its region.

Specific services are provided for spectators during the Games, including the “Transport Public Paris 2024” mobile app, now available for download, a route planner, and specific maps to reach the competition venues, as well as an adapted fare package.

Initial information detailing the train stations, stations, and public transport lines serving each venue can be found in the “How to get there” section of each competition venue's pages.



For more information on public transport in Île-de-France, during the Games, download the “Transport Public Paris 2024” mobile app:

https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/dossiers/app-transport-public-paris2024

label: Où retrouver toutes les informations sur les transports en commun en Île-de-France ?
body:
Pour disposer de conseils pratiques et tout savoir sur le mode d’emploi du réseau de transport en commun d’Île-de-France, les détails des lignes, ou leurs horaires de fonctionnement, il faudra se rapprocher de l’organisme en charge des transports : Île-de-France Mobilités.



L’application mobile « Transport Public Paris 2024 » est disponible en téléchargement :

https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/dossiers/app-transport-public-paris2024



Pour plus d’information, rendez-vous sur :

https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/editorial/preparer-son-sejour-en-ile-de-france

label: Will there be special transport services for spectators during the Games?
body:
Specific services will be established for spectators during the Games, including a dedicated transport mobile app already available, a route planner and specific maps for getting to the competition venues, as well as an adapted fare package.

These will be available a few months before the Paris 2024 Games, and it will be possible to download them before your arrival.



For more information on public transportation, in Île-de-France, download the mobile app “Transport Public Paris 2024” :

https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/dossiers/app-transport-public-paris2024
topics: Spectators;Public transport;Getting to the competition venues

label: Comment les personnes en situation de handicap seront-elles accueillies sur les sites de compétition ?
body:
Paris 2024 s'engage à assurer l'accessibilité des personnes en situation de handicap sur chaque site de compétition en mettant en place les mesures suivantes :

 * Une zone de dépose-minute à proximité des entrées du site pour les PSH

 * Une zone de stationnement pour les PFR et une zone de dépose Navettes IDFM pour PFR

 * Un accompagnement dédié possible dès la zone de pose et de stationnement

 * Une file prioritaire PSH aux entrées du site

 * Du personnel d'accueil dédié aux personnes en situation de handicap

 * Un accompagnement à la mobilité à l'intérieur du site avec possibilité d'utiliser un fauteuil roulant jusqu'au siège

 * Une offre de billetterie spécialement dédiée aux personnes en situation de handicap et à leurs accompagnateurs

 * Un espace d'aisance canine sur chaque site



Retrouvez tous les services mis à disposition des spectateurs PSH et PFR sur notre page dédiée : https://www.paris2024.org/fr/infos-pratiques-accessibilite/

label: Could I drive in Paris during Games?
body:
To anticipate your travels during the Olympic and Paralympic Games period, the Department for Transport has set up a platform to inform the public about security perimeters, traffic conditions, etc.



For more information, please visit:

https://anticiperlesjeux.gouv.fr/



If you live in Paris and Île-de-France, please consult the following sites:

https://www.paris.fr/pages/perimetres-de-securite-et-circulation-pendant-les-jeux-comment-ca-marche-25203

label: Is it possible to receive goodies for our end-of-year event?
body:
Paris 2024 does not distribute goodies outside of promotional events, such as the Olympic and Paralympic Week.



Paris 2024 goodies and items are available on the online shop:

https://shop.olympics.com/en/paris-2024/t-1299990829+z-949567-2073334460?_s=bm-fi-ioc-prtsite-P24-Shoptopnav-120722-fre-mh&loc=en-GB

label: Are the competition venues accessible by public transport?
body:
Paris 2024 has made strong commitments in terms of sustainable mobility to limit the environmental impact of the Games.

In this regard, all venues will be accessible by public transport, and an adapted transport plan will be put in place during the Games.

To travel using public transport, you will use the Île-de-France Mobilités network, which encompasses all the train, RER, metro, tramway, and bus lines in Paris and its region. The information regarding public transport is available on the dedicated mobile app.



To download the “Transport Public Paris 2024” app, please visit:

https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/dossiers/app-transport-public-paris2024
topics: Spectators;Public transport;Getting to the competition venues

label: Who can claim to carry the Flame?
body:
Paris 2024 aims to make the Torch Relay a representation of diverse individuals, including both well-known figures and ordinary people.

The goal is to highlight individuals from all walks of life, spanning different generations and abilities, who inspire others through their achievements, whether big or small, in their everyday lives.



*For more information about individuals with disabilities, please refer to the relevant question.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/torchbearers/
topics: Sports and events;Relay of the Flame;The bearers of the Flame

label: How can I estimate the time between two competition venues in 2024?
body:
For the time being, Paris 2024 advises you not to use route planning applications that do not reflect the transportation plan during the Games, but to rely on the system provided by Paris 2024 on its website.



A dedicated Games application with specific routes to competition venues in  Île-de-France is available.



The mobile app “Public Transport Paris 2024” is now available for download:

https://www.iledefrance-mobilites.fr/dossiers/app-transport-public-paris2024
topics: Spectators;Public transport;Getting to the competition venues

label: How to travel by plane with the CMI card?
body:
If you hold a Carte Mobilité Inclusion (CMI) with mention Invalidité or Priorité, you can enjoy privileged access to baggage drop-off counters and boarding, as well as priority passage in queues before security checks.

To benefit from assistance during your journey, you can submit your request directly online when making your reservation.

Please note that this request must be made at least 48 hours before the departure of your first flight.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/practical-information-accessibility/

label: How can I travel by train if I am in a wheelchair?
body:
Wheelchair users are accommodated on SNCF trains in dedicated spaces, with an average of two places per train, and four when two carriages are coupled.

Assistance at departure and arrival stations is also provided by SNCF.



Remember to book as early as possible! For more information, please visit: https://www.sncf-voyageurs.com/en/travel-with-us/prepare-your-trip/accessibility/

@Teamorangerunning [https://www.instagram.com/teamorangerunning/?hl=fr]

label: How long does the Cultural Olympiad last?
body:
The Cultural Olympiad spans the three years leading up to the Paris 2024 Games, culminating with the closure of the Paralympic Games on 8 September 2024.

A cultural programme is released every season in each of the territories which decided to make sports and culture shine together.



For more information, please visit:

https://olympiade-culturelle.paris2024.org/

label: What will be the Major Events of the Cultural Olympiad?
body:
The projects labelled by the Cultural Olympiad will be presented before September 2024 during periods of major events shared by sport and culture.



These major events include local festivals, Olympic Days, summer festivals, the European Heritage Days 2023 , the Youth Olympiad from April to June 2024, the Amateur Olympiad from 21 to 23 June 2024, and the celebration of the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games.



For more information, please visit:

https://olympiade-culturelle.paris2024.org/

label: What are the criteria for awarding the Génération 2024 label to a Civic Service project?
body:
To obtain the label, schools, educational institutions, and universities must meet the following four criteria:

 * Develop structuring projects with local sports clubs

 * Participate in Olympic and Paralympic events

 * Support or host high-level athletes

 * Open sports facilities within the institutions to local sports associations to promote sports practice



For more information, please visit:

https://generation.paris2024.org/

label: How can I access I'mPossible teaching resources?
body:
I’mPossible is an educational tool produced by the International Paralympic Committee for teachers.

Divided into 3 sections (6-12 years, 12-15 years, and 15-18 years), it introduces the concepts of paralympic values, para sports, and explores inspiring journeys of athletes from around the world.



To obtain the complete resources, including presentations and student activity sheets, please send your request to the e-mail address:

generation2024@paris2024.org

Please provide your name, first name, position, institution, academy, and the purpose of the request.



For more information, please visit:

https://generation.paris2024.org/ressources/les-jeux-paralympiques-plan-de-cours-enseignant

As part of the Olympic and Paralympic Week, registered projects will appear on the interactive map, which lists all the submitted projects.



You can share your actions on social media using the hashtags #Paris2024 #Generation2024 #SOP2024

30 Minutes of Exercise Every Day is a programme designed to promote 30 minutes of daily physical activity at school.

The project aims to encourage young people to move more and to promote the development of children's motor skills and physical abilities.

body:
This sports kit consists of small, versatile sports equipment suitable for use in the school environment:

1 pear whistle / 1 stopwatch / 20 cones / 40 cups / 15 hoops / 20 marking strips / 1 mini vortex / 1 elephant skin ball / 1 multi-activity ball / 1 sound ball / 9 tennis balls / 10 skipping ropes / 10 mini hurdles / 20 chasubles / 15 game scarves.

label: What are the paralympic classifications?
body:
Classifications are essential to ensure fairness between athletes within events.



When athletes compete in a paralympic competition, they are first classified in a disability category governed by a classification system. This classification is carried out by medical and technical professionals whose job it is to assess the impact of the disability on the athlete's sporting ability and performance.



There is no common classification system for all sports, because of their history and the way they are practised, each discipline has its own system.
topics: Sports ;Olympic and paralympic sports;The Games: general questions

label: Why are there no deaf and hard of hearing people?
body:
Deaf and hard-of-hearing individuals have their own Games, called the Deaflympics.



The first Deaflympics were held in Paris in 1924, so they will be 100 years old in 2024!
topics: Sports ;Olympic and paralympic sports;The Games: general questions

label: I've bought tickets for the Games: how and when will I receive the key information I need to prepare for my visit?
body:
From today, you can find the first key information to prepare your arrival on the Paris 2024 website:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/spectators/



In September 2023, an initial e-mail was sent to you to help you prepare for your visit.

Subsequent e-mails will be sent on a regular basis, particularly in 2024.



A Spectator's Guide and an official Paris 2024 mobile application will be released in spring 2024 to help you prepare.

label: Are there any initiatives to raise spectators' awareness of the importance of keeping the venue clean and respecting the sorting areas?
body: Awareness messages will be broadcasted at the competition venues. Pamphlet on recycling will be included with the spectator's guide, and a communication campaign will be launched ahead of the Games.

label: How can I buy tickets for the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
body:
Tickets for the Paris 2024 Olympic Games are available in real-time, both in France and internationally, following the "first come, first served" principle.

To access the sale:

Paris 2024 Official Ticketing - Select sessions [https://tickets.paris2024.org/en/search/?affiliate=24R]



Tickets for various sessions may be made available again leading up to the Olympic Games, so stay tuned!



The tickets for the Paris 2024 Olympic Games are exclusively available for purchase on the official ticketing website, catering to prospective spectators worldwide. No other sales platform is authorized to distribute tickets.



Purchasing tickets or hospitality packages outside the official distribution channels may result in tickets not being received or denial of access to the venues by the organising Committees of the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games, in accordance with the current terms and conditions of sale.



Moreover, any unauthorized sale or resale outside the official distribution channels may constitute both a civil and criminal offense, punishable under Article 313-6-2 of the Penal Code.



An official resale platform is scheduled to open in spring 2024. This will be the exclusive official resale site for ticket holders worldwide.



For any ticketing-related questions, please visit Paris 2024 help center:

https://tickets.paris2024.org/faq/en_en

label: How long is the route for the olympic opening ceremony?
body:
The parade on the Seine will take place over a distance of 6 kilometers, from the Austerlitz Bridge to the Iéna Bridge.

The journey will culminate in front of the Trocadéro for a spectacular finale.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/ceremony/

label: How can I find out more about paralympic sports?
body:
The official program of the Paris 2024 Paralympic Games includes 22 sports and 23 disciplines, comprising 549 events spread across 269 sessions over eleven days of competition.

To find out more about paralympic sports:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/paralympic-sports/



The Paralympic Games classification system ensures fair competitions for all participants.

When an athlete competes in a Paralympic Games event, they are firstly entered into a disability category governed by a classification system.

This classification is carried out by professionals in the medical and technical fields, tasked with assessing the impact of the disability on the athlete's sports gesture and performance.

There is no common classification system for all sports. Due to their history and the nature of their practice, each discipline has its own system.



To learn more about Paralympic Games classification, visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/paralympic-classification/

For any ticketing-related questions, please visit the Paris 2024 help center:

https://tickets.paris2024.org/faq/en_en
topics: Sports ;Olympic and paralympic sports;All you need to know about olympic and paralympic sports

label: One of my Paris 2024 account got hacked, what should I do?
body:
If you notice an unusual activity on your account or if you think that your account has been hacked, Paris 2024 invites you to follow the following steps to regain access to your account and strengthen its security.



On the login page, click on the I've forgotten my password link:



 * Enter the email address used to register for Paris 2024 and we will send you a reset link

 * When creating your new password we recommend you follow the guidelines for setting a strong password here: Paris2024-Awareness-cybersecurity.pdf [https://medias.paris2024.org/uploads/2023/08/Paris2024-Awareness-cybersecurity.pdf]

 * Immediately change your password for applications and sites where you use the same password as for Paris 2024

The deletion request will be applied to all the data collected by the web sites and apps of CIO and Paris 2024 on which you registered, namely: olympics.com [http://olympics.com/], Paris 2024 Club, Marathon Pour Tous, Generation 2024, Terre de Jeux, Cultural Olympiad, the ticketing platform, the Volunteers platform, the Torch Relay platform, ect.

label: How to avoid being victim of a fraud?
body:
Attracted by financial gain, cybercriminals are increasing their efforts to put websites online that usurp everyday services: online messaging, e-commerce sites, banking or administrative services, for example.



When browsing the Internet, you need to pay particular attention to the legitimacy of the websites you visit.

Sensitive transactions should only be carried out on official sites.



To find out more, click here:

Paris2024-Awareness-cybersecurity.pdf#page=3 [https://medias.paris2024.org/uploads/2023/08/Paris2024-Awareness-cybersecurity.pdf#page=3]

label: The financial support granted is renewable?
body:
Recipients of the Paris 2024 endowment Fund benefit from financial support for one year, renewable under conditions, based on the project's level of intervention.

An evaluation questionnaire is sent to each laureate at the end of the support year and is taken into account in the consideration of renewing support for the project.

label: What forms of support does the endowment Fund provide?
body:
The Paris 2024 endowment Fund offers three forms of support:

 1. Usage of the "Impact 2024" Brand: Eligible projects have the opportunity to use the "Impact 2024" brand to enhance their visibility and recognition.

 2. Financial Support: Projects can receive financial assistance ranging from 2,500 to 200,000 euros, contingent upon the level and scope of the initiatives.

 3. Guidance Program: A comprehensive support programme is provided, encompassing both collective and individual elements. It is tailored closely to each laureate, addressing specific needs in the conceptualization, implementation, scaling, or replication of a project.

label: How many projects will be selected?
body: There are no pre-defined quotas for projects, the selection will primarily depend on the quality of the received proposals and the financial allocation granted for each call for projects.

label: Why are there more Olympic torchbearers than Paralympic torchbearers?
body:
The difference with the number of people carrying the Olympic Flame is due to the duration of the journey.



The Paralympic Torch Relay, organised in transition between the two Games, lasts on average a few days, compared with several months for the Olympic Torch Relay.
topics: Torch Relay Route ;The bearers of the Flame

label: How to Participate in  la Danse des Jeux  competition?
body:
The teaching team supervising the participation of a group of 5 to 50 students can enter the Danse des Jeux contest by completing the "Danse des Jeux" project call form on the ADAGE platform.

Schools affiliated with vice-rectorates and members of the AEFE network are invited to fill out form No. 82367 on the simplified procedures platform to participate in the Danse des Jeux competition. This call for projects campaign is open from October 16, 2023, to March 31, 2024.

Registering a class on the ADAGE platform corresponds to registering a group.

The fields "Partners," "Other Partners," "Intervenors," and "Teacher Training" are not mandatory; they should be completed if there is a desire for promotion.

The participation video must be sent via France Transfer to the designated contacts per Academy no later than March 31, 2024.

It must be accompanied by a model release form for each dancer and extra, and a copyright transfer agreement for each involved party, documents available on the Generation 2024 platform starting in January 2024.



Discover the Practical Guide for the Danse des Jeux competition:

https://medias-generation.paris2024.org/2024-02/Paris%202024%20-%20Danse%20des%20Jeux%20-%20Guide%20pratique%20Concours_0.pdf

Paris 2024 provides a time calculator on its website between the stations and the event venues.

This is an estimate; for group travel, it is advisable to allow for additional time.



Discover Paris 2024's time calculator:

College projects are invited to participate in the Danse des Jeux competition through the "Dansons vers 2024" call for projects organized by the FFSU.

label: I am a traveler with a disability, how can I travel by plane?
body:
Air France offers specific services to facilitate the travel of people with reduced mobility through the SAPHIR programme (Service dedicated to Assistance for Persons with Handicaps for Information and Reservations).

This free service is available in France as well as in 20 countries worldwide.

To be considered, your request must reach us at least 48 hours before the departure of your first flight.

Air France acknowledges the Sunflower symbol from the "Hidden disabilities Sunflower®" programme as an emblem to facilitate the identification and travel experience of its customers with invisible disabilities.



To learn more, please visit: https://wwws.airfrance.fr/information/passagers/acheter-billet-avion-pmr-autres-handicaps

label: What is the procedure to be assisted at Transilien stations (Ile-de-France)?
body:
To best prepare for your journey at RER and Train stations operated by SNCF Transilien:



Fill out this form to benefit from assistance for people with disabilities: https://www.garesetconnexions.sncf/fr/assistances-psh-pmr



This free mobile application offers the following features:

 * The layout of each station, its level of accessibility, and the available facilities and services

 * Display of a tailored itinerary to navigate within the station of your choice

 * For service beneficiaries, a connection (via call or SMS) with a Transilien agent in all SNCF Transilien stations in Île-de-France for information or assistance

label: What payment methods are available for the train?
body:
Schools travelling by train will need to provide in advance, through their academic contact for Génération 2024, the details of the paying organization.

Currently, payment is planned to be made via the application using a credit card.

A solution via bank transfer is also being considered but remains to be confirmed

label: The train schedule suggested doesn't suit me, could I reserve another one?
body:
The train numbers provided are those that should be booked by the educational institutions.

For any specific request, please contact the academic representative of Génération 2024.

label: Are activities planned alongside the sports sessions?
body:
Access to Club France is still available under conditions set by the CNOSF.

Workshops will be organized there during the Paralympic Games in partnership with the Ministry of Higher Education and Research at Parc de la Villette in Paris.

label: Will athletes be present at the opening ceremony of the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
body:
The athletes will be at the heart of the spectacle. By placing the parade of delegations at the beginning, Paris 2024 breaks with traditional codes.

From the introduction and throughout the ceremony, they will be integrated into artistic performances, illustrating Paris 2024's commitment to hosting Games for and by athletes.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/ceremony/

label: What is the Génération 2024 civic service?
body:
The Génération 2024 Civic Service programme aims to develop young people's civic engagement through missions promoting the social and environmental impact of sports, in view of the upcoming Olympic and Paralympic Games to be held in France.

These Civic Service missions, lasting from six to twelve months, will allow organizations and engaged youth to:

 * Be part of the Paris 2024 community and promote the values of Olympism

 * Contribute to the Games' legacy and engage with communities to develop or strengthen actions that organizations undertake in their territories for the benefit of populations
   
   

For more information, visit:

https://generation.paris2024.org/

label: Is my project eligible?
body:
In order for a project to be eligible, it must:

 * Be driven by one or more actors from civil society with a general interest: associations, participants in sports movements, and local authorities

 * Demonstrate a general interest character

 * Utilize physical and sports activities as tools for social impact and align with one of the following themes: health, well-being, education, citizenship, inclusion, solidarity, equality, and sustainable development

 * Commence during the year 2024

 * Have the potential for replication or dissemination

 * Take place within the French territory (Mainland France, Overseas Departments and Territories)

 * Not be supported by other funding from ANS, CNOSF, CPSF, or the Paris 2024 Endowment Fund

 * Be led by an organization with more than one year of legal existence
   
   

We invite you to assess your eligibility for project calls before submitting your application:

https://aap-impact.paris2024.org/fr

label: When will my SOP project be validated?
body:
Following the submission of your SOP project on the registration platform, the Paris 2024 teams will proceed with its validation within 1 to 3 week(s).

You will then receive a confirmation email.



For more information, please visit:

https://generation.paris2024.org/semaine-olympique-et-paralympique

label: Is it possible to visit the Paris 2024 headquarters or the competition venues?
body:
Unfortunately, Paris 2024 is unable to accommodate school visits at its headquarters.

As for the competition venues, we encourage you to contact the site managers to arrange your visits.

body: The students eligible for the "Ma classe aux Jeux" program are those who are enrolled in CE2, CM1, 6ᵉ, 5ᵉ, 4ᵉ, 2ᵈᵉ GT et 2ᵈᵉ pro, 1ʳᵉ G/T/Pro and 1ʳᵉ CAP. In the 2023-2024 academic year.

label: When did the 2023 Olympic and Paralympic Week take place?
body:
The 2023 Olympic and Paralympic Week (OPW) took place from April 3rd to April 7th.

Here are some figures for this edition:

 * Over 8,000 schools and establishments participated in the 2023 OPW in 2,000 cities.

 * Over 3,200 projects were submitted.

 * 95% of projects were related to inclusion.

 * Nearly 1 million students were sensitized in 2023 (500,000 in 2021 and 750,000 in 2022).

 * Over 200 Olympic and Paralympic athletes were involved in all regions of France.



For more information, please visit:

https://generation.paris2024.org/semaine-olympique-et-paralympique

label: What are the main differences between the two Games?
body:
The Paralympic Games take place two weeks after the Olympic Games. The Paralympic Games are practiced by athletes with an eligible disability.

There are two sports specific to the Paralympic Games: Boccia and Goalball. Other para sports may have adjustments to equipment or game rules.

The Paralympic Games are governed by the International Paralympic Committee (IPC), headquartered in Bonn, Germany.

The Olympic Games and the Paralympic Games are two brands with different identities and origins: IOC vs. IPC, headquarters in Switzerland vs. Germany, Olympic Rings vs. Paralympic Agitos.



If you want to learn more about the history of the Paralympic Games, key symbols, Paralympic classifications, etc., a training course is available: https://rise.articulate.com/share/Cvl6hk8iDpNyos8UaDylz1ZkyevAFuay



Fact sheets on parasports are also available:

https://sharing.oodrive.com/share-access/sharings/Yq4NnEYB.Rk3qkWk_#/filer/share-access/xyOz3Pkrpnw
topics: Sports ;Olympic and paralympic sports;All you need to know about olympic and paralympic sports

label: I wish to come to France and Paris during the Games. Where can I find information about the main points of interest?
body:
Coming to France during the Games is a unique opportunity to enjoy the many attractions offered by the various host communities.

Visit the websites of the Tourist Offices of each host community to discover the main monuments to visit, the ongoing shows and exhibitions, or the best culinary addresses.



Links to the tourist offices can be found on the official Paris 2024 website in the dedicated spectators' page (section "Extend your stay"):

https://www.paris2024.org/fr/spectateurs/

label: What will happen to the furniture in the Athletes' Village after the Games?
body:
Paris, along with its partners, has committed to ensuring the second life of all the furniture in the Athletes' Village, as with all the Games sites.

Tables, chairs, lockers, beds... will be reused after the event, through various methods: resale, donation, recycling...



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/site/olympic-and-paralympic-village-images/ [https://www.paris2024.org/en/site/olympic-and-paralympic-village-images/For]

label: How will the temporary installations of Paris 2024 be managed in the center of Paris?
body:
The temporary sites of the Olympic and Paralympic Games in the centre of Paris will be installed and dismantled in phased manner with a progressive approach:

Geographical phasing: During the assembly and disassembly phases, the ground area of the installations will be progressively expanded.

Time phasing: The perimeters of the competition sites will be gradually activated and deactivated from the assembly phases to the disassembly phases.

This will help minimize disruptions to traffic lanes and access to public spaces before and after the Games.

For more information on the assembly and disassembly of the sites:

https://www.paris2024.org/fr/Montage-Demontage-Sites/

label: What will be the sorting system implemented by Paris 2024?
body:
Paris 2024 is committed to an environmentally responsible approach.

Consequently, the sorting instructions will be standardized across all sites, from Paris to Marseille, including Saint-Denis.

The aim is to simplify waste sorting to encourage active participation from all audiences.

The rules will be consistent everywhere, aligned with French sorting habits: the brown bin for food waste, the yellow for recyclables, and the grey for other waste. This initiative aims to streamline sorting and promote sustainability during the Games.

label: What will happen to the waste?
body: Biodegradable waste will be composted or anaerobically digested, recyclable waste will be processed into secondary raw materials, and non-recyclable waste will be incinerated.

label: What is the Olympic Day
body:
Every year on 23rd June, Olympic Day is celebrated worldwide, offering everyone the chance to try Olympic sports in the company of athletes, sharing the values of Olympism.

More and more events are organized in this context each year in France, attracting a growing number of participants, both athletes and citizens, in Paris and across the regions.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/olympic-day/

Please note that each application is visible by all of the recruiters.

The Marathon Pour Tous provides a unique opportunity for a diverse audience to share the excitement of the Games, allowing participants to follow in the footsteps of olympic athletes along the same route as the olympic marathon.



This historic event features public running competitions, including both a marathon and a 10km course, scheduled to take place at night for optimal race conditions on August 10, 2024.



For more information, please visit:

label: What is a session?
body:
A session, depending on the sport (and discipline), includes one or several competitions within a specific timeframe.

For example, in:



 * Handball, a session may include one or several matches

 * Swimming, a session includes qualification events held in the morning (from 11 am to 1 pm) or events held in the evening (from 8:30 pm to 10:30 pm), including multiple finals



The Paris 2024 Olympic Games will feature over 750 sessions across all 32 sports in the program.



Surfing is the only sport that will not have ticket sales due to the unique nature of the venue. Details on attending surf sessions will be provided later.



For any ticketing-related questions, please visit the Paris 2024 help center:

https://tickets.paris2024.org/faq/en_en

label: I am a public authority / a group / a company, how do I access the ticketing for the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
body:
Groups:

A group ticketing program (for associations, school and leisure groups, sports clubs, student unions) will be available from March 2024 via a dedicated platform.

To find out if you are eligible for group ticketing for the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games, please send an email to the following address explaining your project:

group-ticketing@paris2024.org.



We would like to remind you that Paris 2024 and its official hospitality provider, On Location, are the only authorized entities to sell the official event tickets globally and to all audiences. Any unauthorized resale by Paris 2024 is prohibited and may result in legal action. For more information, visit our official ticketing website.



Social and Economic Committees (CSE):

A ticketing program for Social and Economic Committees and social welfare management organizations for the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games is open until May 31, 2024, under certain conditions.

For any information request and to find out if you are eligible for this program, please contact our sales team by email at the following address:

ticketing-cse@paris2024.org



Please note that you can also purchase hospitality packages (tickets + services) from ON LOCATION, the official and exclusive hospitality provider for Paris 2024, on the website:

https://corporatehospitality.paris2024.org/.



Businesses:

At present, there is no individual ticketing program for the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games aimed at businesses. We remind you that you can purchase hospitality packages from ON LOCATION, the official, and exclusive hospitality provider for Paris 2024, on the website:

https://corporatehospitality.paris2024.org/



However, if the access conditions to individual ticketing for the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games for businesses change in the coming months, we will inform you through this channel.

If your employees wish to purchase tickets for personal use, please redirect them to our official public ticketing website.



Public Authorities:

Host Communities, Torch Relay Partner Communities, and Entities labelled as "Terre de Jeux 2024" had privileged access to the ticketing for the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games. This ticketing program is now closed. We invite you to contact the labelled entities in your area to discuss the conditions and modalities for integration into their ticketing programme.

label: What types of seats are available for spectators with special accessibility needs?
body:
Paris 2024 is committed to meeting all accessibility needs.

Two types of accessible seats are available for spectators with specific accessibility needs:



1 - Wheelchair Spaces (WCS):

These tickets are intended for individuals using a wheelchair.

WCS are available for all sessions and sports offered during this sale period, subject to availability.

The WCS seats offered on the platform will be in the lower-priced categories, regardless of the venue's configuration. The allocated seat will correspond to a category equal to or higher than the selected seat category.



2 - Easy Access Seats (EAS):

These tickets are for individuals with disabilities and reduced mobility who do not use a wheelchair but require an accessible seat, typically involving minimal steps and proximity to accessible facilities.

Accessible seats (EAS) will be available in various categories for all sessions and sports, configured as seated positions and according to the corresponding category's tariff, subjected to availability.

The available categories of accessible seats (EAS) will be displayed on the official ticketing platform at the time of purchase.



Individuals with disabilities can, of course, be accompanied and may purchase a ticket for an accompanying person.

Paris 2024 is committed to meeting all accessibility needs.



For any ticketing-related questions, please visit the Paris 2024 help centre:

https://tickets.paris2024.org/faq/en_en

label: What documents do I need to travel to France during the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games?
body:
Individuals from non-EU countries must meet specific conditions according to prevailing regulations for entry into the Schengen area.

Depending on your country of origin, a visa may be necessary.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/spectators/

label: Is there a deposit system for spectators at the competition venues?
body:
There will be no bag deposit within or near the venue.

Therefore, Paris 2024 invite spectators to only bring essential items with them and to carefully read the prohibited items list.

This list will be indicated in the Spectator’s Guide, which will be sent by e-mail before the session.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/spectators/

label: How to find accommodation during the Games?
body:
With the Games approaching, Paris 2024 advises you to anticipate booking your accommodation as much as possible.



You will find on the spectators' page our tips for finding the most suitable accommodation solution for your needs, (section "accommodation during the Games"):

https://www.paris2024.org/en/spectators/

label: Will I have mobile coverage regardless of my mobile operator?
body:
Paris 2024 is collaborating with all mobile operators to ensure good mobile coverage across all competition venues.



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/spectators/

label: What will be the emergency arrangements at the Paris 2024 competition venues?
body:
Health and emergency services will be set up at all Paris 2024 venues.

First-aiders and doctors will be on hand to treat spectators and accredited visitors.



The facilities will be operational from the opening to the closing to the public.

label: Will I be able to return to the venue once I've left?
body:
Once you have left the venue, please note that your exit is final.

To return, you will need a valid ticket for the next session.

label: What is the schedule for dismantling the Paris 2024 facilities in Paris?
body:
The dismantling schedule is currently being defined with the State and the City of Paris, aiming to free up the spaces as early as possible.

Dismantling will begin after the last competitions at each site and will be completed no later than the end of October 2024, with the total release of public space.

As the Games approach, Paris 2024 and the responsible public authorities for these areas will provide the most accurate information possible to allow everyone to adapt to the various arrangements made for the Games period.



For more information on the setup and dismantling of the sites:

https://www.paris2024.org/fr/Montage-Demontage-Sites/

Read the press kit:

Find more information regarding the different security perimeters and specific situations on the City of Paris website:

https://www.paris.fr/pages/perimetres-de-securite-pendant-les-jeux-de-paris-2024-les-reponses-a-vos-questions-25632

All information regarding these events, including venue details and dates, is available on the Cultural Olympiad website.

https://olympiade-culturelle.paris2024.org/

label: Why isn't there more mental and psychic representation?
body:
To date, 3 para sports are open at the Paralympic Games to para athletes with a mental or psychological disability:



 * Para athletics

 * Para swimming

 * Para table tennis



Disciplines and disability representation are the responsibility of the International Paralympic Committee [https://www.paralympic.org/].

Every 4 years, applications are reviewed to determine whether other eligible para sports or disabilities should be included.



In addition, the Virtus Global Games is an international competition for individuals with intellectual disabilities, some of whom have additional conditions such as Down syndrome or autism spectrum disorders.
topics: Sports ;Olympic and paralympic sports;The Games: general questions

label: On which channel can I watch the Games in France?
body:
The Olympic Games will be broadcasted in their entirety by Eurosport, which will offer themed channels Eurosport 1 to 9, as well as all the competitions with commentary on its digital platform.



It will also be possible to watch the Olympic Games free-to-air on the France Télévisions group channels: France 2, France 3, and France 4.



The Paralympic Games will be fully broadcast on France Télévisions 24/7.

label: Can people with disabilities carry the Flame?
body:
Yes, the Olympic Torch Relay and the Paralympic Torch Relay are both accessible to people with disabilities.

Disabled people will be accompanied if they need assistance.
topics: Torch Relay Route ;The bearers of the Flame

label: Where will the Flame go?
body:
The Olympic Torch Relay route was unveiled on June 23rd, 2023!



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/olympic-torch-relay-route/
topics: Torch Relay Route ;The Torch Relay route

label: When and where does the Paralympic Torch Relay start?
body:
The Paralympic Flame will be lit in Stoke Mandeville in the UK on August 24, 2024.



It will then travel through the Channel Tunnel to Calais in France on August 25, 2024.



On its arrival in Calais, the Flame will be divided into 12 Flames, which will be relit on the borders of France, marking the start of the Paralympic festivities!
topics: Torch Relay Route ;The Torch Relay route

label: How long does the Paralympic Torch Relay last?
body:
The Paralympic Torch Relay will cross the whole of France for 4 consecutive days from August 25 to 28, 2024: 12 Flames will go their own way, converging and reuniting in the center of Paris.



The Flames will go out to meet French residents in every region of the Hexagon to pass on a message full of enthusiasm: "The Games are back! "
topics: Torch Relay Route ;The Torch Relay route

label: Where does the Paralympic Flame come from? What does it represent?
body:
The Paralympic Flame is lit a few days before the Paralympic Games in the United Kingdom at Stoke Mandeville. This location is associated with the birth of the Paralympic movement.



Indeed, it is a hospital where the German neurologist Sir Ludwig Gutman organized the first competitions to accelerate the recovery of his paraplegic patients, all veterans of World War II.

label: How was the Paralympic Torch Relay route designed?
body:
The Paralympic Torch Relay route was designed in close collaboration with the territories involved in the Relay, with the official sponsors, Coca-Cola, Banques Populaires and Caisses d'Epargne, and with the French Paralympic and Sports Committee, with the aim of valorizing territories committed to greater integration through sport.



It has also been designed to raise the profile of committed sporting cities close to the Games, as well as cities that are symbolic of France's history and heritage.
topics: Torch Relay Route ;The Torch Relay route

label: Why isn't the product made in France?
body:
Paris 2024 favors products made in France as much as possible.

Our commitment is to offer at least one made in France reference for each product category.

label: What does Paris 2024 have to offer structures awarded the Génération 2024 programme?
body:
Being labelled "Génération 2024" means committing to bringing more sports into the daily lives of young people and enabling as many as possible to experience the Olympic and Paralympic adventure.



The Generation 2024 programme provides:



 * Access to exclusive content (educational resources, calls for projects, challenges, etc.)

 * Recognition of the commitment and work of educational teams with an exclusive visual identity and communication tools

 * Benefits from the territorial dynamics driven by the Games, especially through the local authorities that have been awarded the Terre de Jeux 2024 label

 * Privileged access to information, tools, and events related to the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games

 * Integration into the Génération 2024 community to share best practices and advice with other label holders

 * Receipt of the label holder's kit to proudly wear the colours of the label



For more information, please visit:

https://generation.paris2024.org/label-generation-2024 [https://generation.paris2024.org/label-generation-2024%EF%BF%BC]

Establishments awarded the programme will receive a kit to highlight and reward their commitment.



This kit will be sent by post and contains the following items:



 * A wall plaque to be installed in their school or establishment

 * A flag to accompany their events

 * A diary to keep track of the actions taken as part of the Génération 2024 label implementation

 * A reusable bag to store or transport small sports equipment



For more information, please visit:

https://generation.paris2024.org/label-generation-2024
