label: What are the Olympic lanes and will they remain open to general traffic?
body:
The Olympic lanes are the lanes used by Paris 2024 service vehicles, emergency and security vehicles, and other authorized vehicles identified in the decree.

They can be reserved and will be marked by road markings and signs.

On the Paris ring road and motorways, this refers to a lane or section of lane reserved in each direction.



The Olympic lanes are established by decree. The activation dates of these lanes and the control procedures will be announced by the Prefecture of Police:

https://www.prefecturedepolice.interieur.gouv.fr [https://www.prefecturedepolice.interieur.gouv.fr/]



More information on traffic conditions is available here:

https://anticiperlesjeux.gouv.fr/

label: Where to buy the Panini Equipe de France album?
body:
The Panini album of the French Olympic and Paralympic Team is available in over 22,000 points of sale (newsagents, supermarkets, news-stands, etc.) and on the Panini website.



If you wish to purchase the Panini album of the French Team, visit:

https://www.panini.fr/shp_fra_fr/cartes-stickers/sport/equipe-de-france-olympique-paralympique.html

label: How can I sign up to be a volunteer?
body:
Those with programmes had the opportunity during the year 2022 to nominate residents for the volunteer programme.

The selected individuals were contacted by the Paris 2024 teams.

label: What is the Panini France Team album?
body:
On April 2, 2024, to celebrate its 50th anniversary, Panini France launched a sticker collection dedicated to the French Olympic and Paralympic Team.

Comprising 469 stickers, including 81 special ones, this 80-page album offers a true gallery of portraits representing 441 athletes who will proudly represent France this summer. From established stars to emerging talents, athletes from all sports are highlighted in the album, illustrating the diversity and richness of French sports and talent.

Rules, anecdotes, history, and the number of medals won since the first modern Olympic Games—every sport and discipline are represented and explained.

This album serves as an essential guide to follow the event day by day and to grasp the determination of French athletes through beautifully illustrated stickers.

Thanks to these stickers, fans will have the opportunity to support their champions throughout their Olympic and Paralympic journey, creating an unbreakable bond between supporters and athletes!



For more information, please visit:

https://www.equipedefrance.com/article/panini-efr

label: Is a dedicated mobile app planned for the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games?
body:
A dedicated mobile app designed for the Paris 2024 Games is available now for download!

This application allows users to access competition schedules, results, and exclusive content about the Games and athletes.

For spectators, it will offer various features, including:

 * An interactive map of the competition venue

 * Details about specific sessions

 * A link to the Spectator's Guide, and more



This mobile application distinguishes itself from the mobile app for accessing your ticket, which will be released in mid-May.



Download the official app:

https://olympics.com/en/download-olympics-mobile-app? [https://olympics.com/en/download-olympics-mobile-app?_branch_match_id=1298005965559121406&utm_source=olympics.com&utm_campaign=download-app-lp-qr-code&utm_medium=site&_branch_referrer=H4sIAAAAAAAAA8soKSkottLXz8%2BpzC3ITC7WSywo0MvJzMvWTzQ1T%2FF3Da1IzEoCACOderolAAAA]



For more information, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/spectators/

label: Is it possible to use the Paris 2024 emblem?
body:
The use of Olympic, Paralympic, and Paris 2024 properties is strictly regulated. Commercial and institutional partners of the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games have exclusive rights to them.

In other words, visual and verbal properties cannot be used for commercial, representation, or communication purposes by individuals who have not entered into a contract with Paris 2024, the IOC, or IPC.



You can find all the information regarding our brand protection policy in this guide:

https://medias.paris2024.org/uploads/2023/07/BIL_20230703_Brand_Protection.pdf



To apply for a Paris 2024 brand licence, it's necessary to respond to a call for expressions of interest.

The call for expressions of interest is published on

https://www.paris2024.org/en/

https://www.maximilien.fr/

label: What does the emblem of Paris 2024 represent?
body:
The emblem of Paris 2024 combines three iconic symbols to embody human and fraternal Games:

 * The Olympic Flame

 * The Marianne

 * A medal from the Games

And because the Olympic and Paralympic Games are two sides of the same coin, in 2024 they share the same logo for the first time, symbolizing a shared vision and ambition.



To learn more, please visit:

https://www.paris2024.org/en/paris-2024-a-unique-emblem/

label: Why is Paris 2024 only offering digital tickets?
body:
Paris 2024 offers a 100% digital ticketing system through a single official sales website, accessible worldwide. This ensures the security of all purchases and facilitates the management of tickets for buyers.

Digital tickets help to limit fraud and illegal resale, guaranteeing ticket holders access to competition venues.

Tickets will be made available through a dedicated mobile application closer to the Games.



Please note that the ticketing app is distinct from the Paris 2024 Games app.



For any ticketing-related questions, please visit the Paris 2024 help center:

https://tickets.paris2024.org/faq/en_en

label: What is the Celebration Kit?
body:
Paris 2024 offers items (flags, bunting garlands, supporter hands) in the Games' Look to the Terre de Jeux 2024 accredited entities so that they can distribute them to the actors of their territory to decorate and celebrate the magic of the Games.



Orders are now closed.



The Celebrations Kit is also supplemented with 24 action sheets accessible to all via the network of Terre de Jeux 2024 accredited entities, the sports movement, the government, and Paris 2024 partners, allowing you to discover good ideas to get active!
topics: Other;Terre de Jeux;Other (organisation, communication, funding, CPJ)

label: What are the Fan Section?
body:
The Fan Section, sponsored by EDF, are festive zones that will be deployed at each competition venue during the Olympic and Paralympic Games (except for the surfing site at Teahupo'o).

During most sessions, between 50 and 1,500 spectators will be part of these Fan Section, celebrating the athletes and their performances.

During sessions where French athletes are competing, these section will be draped in blue to give even more energy to the athletes of Team France and push them towards victory.
topics: Paris 2024 Club / Marathon Pour Tous;Paris 2024 Club;Fan Section

label: Will access to Paris 2024 Celebration sites be free?
body:
The Celebration sites of Paris 2024 listed on the Games Map will be, for the most part, free to access.



For more information, please visit:

https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/the-games/celebrating/celebrating-the-games

label: Where can I find a bicycle to get to the competition venues?
body:
To access the various competition sites, you will have the option to rent bicycles through specialized services or to use bicycles from bike-sharing schemes.

In Île-de-France, the fleet of bike-sharing bicycles will be expanded, and temporary stations will be installed near the competition sites.

In the host cities hosting competitions, bike-sharing services are also available.

All information regarding bike-sharing services can be found on the websites of the host municipalities.

label: How to become part of the Fan section?
body:
For the Olympic Games, ticket buyers in the category concerned by the were contacted at the end of 2023 to choose whether they wanted to join this lively section.

152,000 expressed interest in these Fan sections.

For the Paralympic Games, specific “Fan Section” tickets will be available for sale on the Paris 2024 ticketing platform soon.
